poem:
**An Ending Note**

The measured sting  
of science, wrapped  
in sterile ribbon—  
a promise whispered  
to a weary frame.  
Yet, beneath this  
lace of hope,  
the body's desperate  
salute, organs  
softly failing—  
a silent hymn  
for Susan, whose  
autumn dreams  
found wayward rest  
in the shadow's  
unexpected embrace.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Approved weight-loss drug contributed to UK nurse’s death, report says A weight-loss drug recently approved for use on the NHS contributed to the death of a 58-year-old nurse from North Lanarkshire, according to a report. Susan McGowan took two low-dose injections of tirzepatide, under the Mounjaro brand, over the space of a fortnight before she died on 4 September, the BBC reported. Her death certificate, seen by the broadcaster, lists multiple organ failure, septic shock". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Approved weight-loss drug contributed to UK nurse’s death, report says A weight-loss drug recently approved for use on the NHS contributed to the death of a 58-year-old nurse from North Lanarkshire, according to a report. Susan McGowan took two low-dose injections of tirzepatide, under the Mounjaro brand, over the space of a fortnight before she died on 4 September, the BBC reported. Her death certificate, seen by the broadcaster, lists multiple organ failure, septic shock
